[color=#FFFFE0][b]Junk and PM Prune[/b][/color]
On August the 31st our administrator [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] took Hack Forums offline for about 15 minutes to do a Junk and PM prune. This means that all the junked threads and PM's have been deleted from the server. User post counts have been recounted and are accurate once again.[i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5392182]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=#FFFFE0][b]Possible new award[/b][/color]
Two days ago [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] hinted that he was thinking about adding a Monero award to Hack Forums, and asked the community for opinions. The majority of our members expressed their exitement about the possibility of a new award. If this award is implemented members can donate using the Monero (XMR) cryptocoin to obtain it.[i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5394128]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=#FFFFE0][b]HF Served How?[/b][/color]
A couple of days ago ago [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] made a thread in which he explained how he is hosting Hack Forums. In this thread he explains through which layers of security all traffic goes, before it reaches the server on which the website is hosted. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] also mentioned that Hack Forums got around 3 billion requests last month, of which The majority originated from attacks on the website. Some members joked about the fact that they now know everything about Hack Forum's security, but [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] is clearly not one to be startled easily.[i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5394059]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5392182][b]Junk and PM Prune[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Noticed a decrease in your post count? Omniscient decided to prune the junk section again, so your junked posts are now completely gone. Looks a lot cleaner!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5396293][b]Username Visible Characters[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Omniscient has decided to put a rule new in place that states that you must have at least four visible characters in your username. This means you can't have names that just have three visible characters and one invisible one anymore.

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5387776][b]Beginners Hacking Helpdesk<-Ask Your Questions Here[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2860712][color=#00AAFF][b]spirited_wolf™[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Want to learn more about hacking? Visit spirited's helpdesk and see if he can help you. If he's able to help you, help him out by leaving some positive feedback on his thread!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5396424][b]Sneaky technique[/b][/url] -  [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3045809][color=#FFFFFF][b]phpdevsami[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]phpdevsami is providing you with a useful trick that may be of use to you if you are into SEO and internet marketing. If you are, check the hyperlink to view the thread.

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5356432][b]Anime Subtitle Conversation Thread [2016 Edition!][/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=153630][color=#00AAFF][b]SewDough[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]This thread provides you with some pretty... Unique pictures that you'll either hate or love. Check it out and leave a reply.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5392734][b]Discrimination against drug users[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3087067][color=#00AAFF][b]Abraluna[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Abraluna has created a very interesting thread that aims to spark discussion about the discrimination against drug users. If you are into debates, check his thread out and discuss with the other SRPP users.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5384339][b][EVERYONE] Riyu's Award/Upgrade Contest [#3][/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3129680][color=#FFFFFF][b]Riyu[/b][/color][/url]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5371183][b]$20 PP/BTC CONTEST || UPGRADED AND NON-UPGRADED MEMBERS[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2518836][color=#FFFFFF][b]Mr. Burnham[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Mr. Burnham is giving away $20 through either PayPal or Bitcoin. Take a look at his thread and enter if you wish to.

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5391731][b]A weird problem[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2329096][color=#00AAFF][b]Quaff[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The member Quaff is having problems with his erections. If you have the answer to his question, please help him out. Visit the thread for more details.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5396873][b][DOGMONEY +] <<LEARN HOW A DOG MAKES $3000 A DAY>>[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3123052][color=#FFFFFF][b]Fortunate[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Thanks to Fortunate and his dog I have already made over $30,000 with my son Big Hoss. Check this thread out if you want to get the same results!

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955]Happeh:[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Hello and welcome to the 307th edition of the HF news. Any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955][color=white][b]Happeh:[/b][/color][/url] To my boys: Angel, Gladly and Barrier.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]  To start things off, how'd you join HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955][color=white][b]Happeh:[/b][/color][/url]  I joined like every 13 year old kid does, looking for hacking tips. I quickly dropped that idea and motivation after a week and ended up just staying because of the community. I ended up making a home in Anime Adventures and have been there since posting away.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] I also noticed that you're into photography, what's your setup?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955][color=white][b]Happeh:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah, I use a Canon 700D with a 80mm-120mm Lens as my digital rig. I also have two film cameras: one a Pentax KM 35mm which I love and have been using as my main, and a 50mm Mamiya C330 which I've recently purchased but can't wait to use. I'm very lucky in that my University has a loan system for equipment so I can borrow any expensive stuff (Leica, Zeiss lenses etc.) and just use them when I'm out doing a shoot.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Is photography your job? What else do you do outside of HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955][color=white][b]Happeh:[/b][/color][/url] Photography is something I do as freelance but it's mainly side cash and just a hobby. I do earn from it but not really enough to call myself a "professional" haha. I'm currently a student outside of HF, studying Media so that keeps me busy most of the time. I also work as a Technician at a little venue, my role specifically is looking after the sound and lights keeping things running.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah, making money from photos is tough nowadays. Have you met up with anyone you knew on HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955][color=white][b]Happeh:[/b][/color][/url] Never. Don't quite like the idea of meeting people from HF IRL. On top of that most of the friends I make from here are normally from the USA so unless I want to fly 1000s of miles, there isn't much chance of that ever happening. 

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] What's your thoughts on the state of HF? Think you'll be around for years to come?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955][color=white][b]Happeh:[/b][/color][/url] HF right now is a weird one for me. I'm enjoying it but its more the people than the forum itself. I'm always around so I think I'll still be here in another 6 years unless something happens. I'm more surprised I haven't been closed already.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for joining me for this interview, any final words?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=279955][color=white][b]Happeh:[/b][/color][/url]  No, thank you very much for interviewing me and as always well done to the whole writers team. I've been there and I know how much of a thankless job it can be so you guys deserve all the praise.
[/align]
[/align]
[/spoiler]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

posts.message:

[b][color=white]Template Changes[/color][/b]
You may notice some changes in the way the news looks in Edition 308. We're making changes to improve readability for our readers. Have any suggestions in how you'd like things to be laid out, let us know on this thread.

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/5EHiJAb.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tech/slideshows/Reliance-Jio-9-things-it-offers-to-customers/itslideshow/53959823.cms][b]India's Richest Man Launches Largest 4G LTE Network in the World[/b][/url][/color]
After numerous delays and months of testing, India's richest man, Mukesh Ambani, launched the world's largest 4G LTE network through his telecom company, Reliance Jio. Reliance Jio will offer free voice calls, text messaging, and roaming when it makes its new network available on September 5 to 90% of India's population, or 1.126 billion people, with super fast LTE data that peaks at 135 Mbps. How much per gigabyte? 50 Rupees, or $0.75, per gigabyte of data. That is insanely cheap even by India's telecom standards, as Reliance Jio is apparently charging one-tenth of what other Indian carriers charge, according to The Times of India. And students will also get an extra 25% of data free. 

[color=white][url=http://www.androidcentral.com/samsung-expected-recall-galaxy-note-7s-over-battery-quality-concerns][b]Samsung Expected to Announce a Galaxy Note 7 Recall Due to Exploding Batteries[/b][/url][/color]
Samsung earlier this week halted Galaxy Note 7 shipments in South Korea following several reports of exploding batteries, in spite of the phone’s massive preorder sales success. According to South Korea's Yonhap News Agency, an unnamed Samsung official says the company is conducting an investigation and is expected to announce the results this weekend or early next week at the latest. "Products installed with the problematic battery account for less than 0.1 percent of the entire volume sold. The problem can be simply resolved by changing the battery, but we'll come up with convincing measures for our consumers," said the official.

[color=white][url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT207130][b]Apple Issues Global Security Updates After Spyware Hack Exposed[/b][/url][/color]
Apple has issued an urgent OS X security patch to block a flaw that could allow attackers to remotely gain access to devices. The security flaw affects the El Capitan and Yosemite Mac operating systems, with the flaw understood to be related to recently discovered iOS vulnerabilities. The patch addresses memory corruption and validation issues, which if exploited would give hackers kernel access on your machine — and from there, they could do pretty much whatever they wanted. The update follows a patch for iOS devices running version 9.3.5 this week, which suffered from essentially the same issues. 
[/align]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]
[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemons-eevee-coming-to-build-a-bear-workshops/1100-6443118/][color=white]Pokemon's Eevee is Coming to Build-A-Bear Workshops![/color][/url][/b]
Build-A-Bear Workshops introduced Pikachu to their huge collection of stuffed animals earlier this year and now they're continuing to capitalized on the Pokemon Go craze by adding Eevee! If you want to added Eevee to your collection of adorable plushes. The base price is $28 and will get you the 14-inch Eevee plush as well as a Build-A-Bear exclusive trading card. You can dish out more money to dress your Eevee up in a hooded Eevee-evolution cape or Poke Ball pajamas. The pajamas cost $12.50, while the hooded cape comes in a $62 online-exclusive package that comes with Eevee, a five-in-one sound chip, both costumes, and the trading card. Eevee comes to Build-A-Bear Workshops in the United States, Canada, and UK on September 1.

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-buddy-system-confirmed-sounds-pretty-co/1100-6443287/][color=white]Pokemon Go Buddy System Confirmed![/color][/url][/b]
Pokemon Go is getting an exciting new feature in a future update! Developer Niantic Labs confirmed the online rumors to be true and discussed the Buddy Pokemon feature, but did well to keep specifics on the low. However, what we do know sounds incredible! "You will be able to pick your favorite Pokemon from your collection to become your buddy, opening up unique in-game rewards and experiences," Niantic said. "Buddy Pokemon will appear alongside your Trainer avatar on your profile screen, adding helpful bonuses such as awarding Candy for walking together. You'll also have the ability to change your Buddy Pokemon at any time." Niantic refused to give a set date on when the feature would go live but they teased that it is "right around the corner." In addition to this new feature, the studio said there are "a lot more" updates coming this fall. I will keep you guys updated with the latest Pokemon Go news as it becomes available! What features would you like to see in the future?


[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/fallout-4s-new-dlc-honors-fan-who-passed-away/1100-6443295/][color=white]Fallout 4 Honors Fan's Brother that Passed[/color][/url][/b]
Nuka-World, Fallout 4's newest and last DLC expansion, features a heartwarming tribute to a fan who passed away. A week after the release of Nuka-World, it has been discovered that Bethesda based a character on the fan who unfortunately passed. Reddit user NoohjXLVII wrote a message months ago that talked about how playing Fallout 4 helping him get through the pain of losing his father a year earlier. Unfortunately, that wasn't the end of his heartbreaking year. He went on to detail how his 24-year-old brother was admitted to the ICU with a diabetes-related illness. His younger brother died in the hospital. NoohjXLVII poster another message to Reddit recently and stated that Bethesda responded to his first post by including his brother, Evan, into the latest DLC expansion. Nuka-World features NoohjXLVII's brother on the outskirts of the map enjoying the scenery. It is poetic and NoohjXLVII said that it does very well to capture the essence of his recently passed brother. You're able to speak to Evan in the game. Eventually, Evan will give you with a "Nuka-Love" recipe for free. Evan's brother insists that you shouldn't feel guilty for taking it because "He insists you take it and in real life he would give you the shirt off of his back to help those in need," he stated. Bethesda also sent NoohjXLVII a wonderful package full of various goodies that you can view [url=http://imgur.com/a/rkssE]here.[/url] The video of Evan can be seen [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3NBZHcgSqNc]here[/url] as well. 

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oUjgZn4w6pA[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Trends.png[/img][/align]

[url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/wave-of-bombings-against-government-allied-parts-of-syria-kills-40/2016/09/05/557202e0-af76-40a6-9666-e46a59d4b154_story.html][color=#FFFFFF][b]Bombs in Syria Kills 40[/b][/color][/url]
Multiple bombs have went off in various parts of Syria, specifically at government checkpoints, on September 5. The Islamic State is claiming credits for the multiple bombs planted in Hasakah and the northeastern city of Qamishli. However, the Islamic State is not claiming credits for the other bombs planted that wounded more than 50 people. Despite bombings being a very frequent occurrence in Syria, attacks in Hasakah and Tartous are quite rare due to the area being populated by the Alawite sect. 

[url=http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/705718/bikini-selfie-smuggle-cocaine-Australia-Canada-women-beauty-holiday-drugs][color=#FFFFFF][b]Two Women Caught With 95 Kilograms of Cocaine[/b][/color][/url]
Apparently literally anyone can be a part of the drug network now. Two Canadian women, Melina Roberge and Isabelle, were attempting to smuggle around 95 kilograms of cocaine, which equates to around £17.5 million, into Australia. The two took a Sea Princess Cruise from Britain to Australia that visited Canada, United States, Colombia, Peru, and finally, Auckland. What makes this more unique, in my opinion, is the fact that one of the women documented the entire trip up to the day she got caught on her Instagram, which can be viewed [url=https://www.instagram.com/melinar___/]here[/url].

[url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/steve-irwin-crocodile-hunter-death-000000379.html][color=#FFFFFF][b]10 Years Since Steve Irwin's Death[/b][/color][/url]
People from different parts of the world have gathered together to pay tribute towards the notorious "Crocodile Hunter". On September 4, it has been 10 years since the tragedy that ended Steve Irwin's life. Irwin was killed by a stingray while filming for his show. Not only did he leave his show permanently, but he also left his family that included his wife and two children. Irwin's daughter, Bindi Irwin, tweeted out, "You'll be my hero for my entire existence. I love you more than words can describe."
